treatment.description: Plants 0.8–3 × 0.5–1.3(–1.5) dm. Leaves: petiole 0.2–0.8 cm, base indistinct, tomentose abaxially; blade linear-oblanceolate to elliptic, (1–)1.5–4(–5) × 0.2–1 cm, margins usually plane. Scapes 0.8–2.5(–3) dm. Flowers 2–2.5 mm. Achenes 3–3.5 mm. 2n = 40.
treatment.discussion: Variety panguicense is widespread and infrequent to locally common in Garfield, Iron, Kane, Millard, Sanpete, Sevier and Washington counties. It would be an attractive addition to the rock garden.
